net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.impl.lucene

Class LuceneSearchIndexerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.AbstractSearchIndexerBuilder
          • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.impl.lucene.LuceneSearchIndexerBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchIndexerBuilder

    public class LuceneSearchIndexerBuilder
extends AbstractSearchIndexerBuilder
    This is the implementation of SearchIndexerBuilder using lucene as underlying search-engine.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • doInitialize

        protected void doInitialize()
        This method performs the actual initialization. It is called when AbstractComponent.initialize() is invoked for the first time.
        ATTENTION:
        When you override this method from a sub-class you need to do a super.AbstractComponent.doInitialize().
        Overrides:
        doInitialize in class AbstractLoggableComponent

      • createIndexer

        public SearchIndexer createIndexer(SearchIndexerConfigurationHolder configurationHolder,
                                   SearchIndexerOptions options)
                            throws SearchException
        This method opens a new SearchIndexer.
        ATTENTION:
        Only one indexer should be open at a time (for the same location). You have to close the indexer before calling this method again.
        ATTENTION:
        Be careful when overwriting the search-index. You may loose valuable data.
        Parameters:
        configurationHolder - is the SearchIndexerConfigurationHolder.
        options - are the SearchIndexerOptions.
        Returns:
        the create indexer.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.
